Her True Name is Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus, the fifth emperor of the Roman Empire. She is an infamous tyrant whose entire life was colored by conspiracy and poison.
Umu!
Nero Claudius

Roman circus was a large open-air venue used for public events in the ancient Roman Empire. Along with theatres, amphitheatres, and the similar but much smaller stadiums, circuses were one of the main entertainment sites of the time. Circuses were venues for chariot races, horse races, gladiatorial combat, and performances that commemorated important events of the Empire were performed there.

Her mother hired Seneca, a famous Stoic philosopher at that time, as Nero's tutor. Before she became emperor, she had outstanding talents. It is said that because of her impartiality and ability, she was repeatedly brought into important lawsuits and had gave speeches at the Senate in both Greek and Latin.

She inherited the throne at the age of 17. During her reign, she devoted herself to developing the status of Rome as the cultural capital of the Mediterranean. She also designed the Golden Palace herself, and its ruins can still be seen in Rome today.

In 56, following the example of the Olympic Games in Greece, the "Nero Festival" was established as an athletics event that opened every five years. There were three departments of music, sports, and horse riding, and Nero had played in several of them.

In the early days of her reign, Nero showed herself as a wise monarch, enthusiastically participated in public affairs, and did not forget to treat her subordinates with a very low profile, leaving a friendly image for the people; but after she killed her mother and teacher in a bloody way for power, the respect from the elders and nobles began to fade, and gradually became brutal and licentious, which greatly reduced the image of the Roman emperor in the history books, and was called "Bloodthirsty Nero" by the world.

During her reign, Nero had suppressed the uprising of Britannia, which had just been incorporated into the empire. The leader, Queen Boudica, died in the war with the Romans. In the later period of her reign, local Jewish residents triggered a full-scale resistance against the brutal governor of Palestine. The long war eventually led to the separation of the Jewish people for two thousand years. Nero maintained a friendly relationship with the Parthia Empire during her reign. It is said that the reason why Parthia did not take advantage of the opportunity after the emperor was overthrown was to take care of Nero's country.

During the rebellion in 69, Nero was deposed from the throne and fled from Rome. At the critical juncture, she realized that she couldn't escape and made up her mind to commit suicide. However, her end didn't seem very happy. "Is such a good artist going to disappear from this world?" After crying several times like this, she stopped, and finally stabbed herself in the throat with a dagger. Nero did not die for three days after committing suicide, until a Roman soldier found the emperor who was thought to be dead in the wilderness and covered her with a cloth. At this time, she suddenly opened her eyes and said to the soldier: "It's really late, but thank you" before dying completely.

Please note that while it is true that Nero herself loves luxury and has a cruel personality, many of the image of a tyrant is the result of smearing by later generations. After the Great Fire of Rome in 1964, rumors spread in the city that "Nero deliberately set fire to rebuild the city of Rome". In order to quell the rumors, the emperor used Christians as a shield. Later, after Christianity spread throughout Europe, Nero's brutal deeds were vigorously promoted, including setting fire to the city. Another part of the slander came from the aristocratic class in Rome at that time, because Nero pursued an anti-noble and pro-commoner policy during his reign that hurt the interests of the nobility, so they, who had the right to speak, smeared Nero after she was overthrown.
Please note, again, that the above content is the setting of Nero in TypeMoon, please do not take it as real history.
